thread.title: Cheap Halloween costumes if you have no money
thread.title_full: Cheap Halloween costumes if you have no money - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Cheap Halloween costumes if you have no money
text:
Andy Crawford/Getty Images/Dorling Kindersley All that’s needed for this staple costume is an old sheet. Halloween costumes can be frightfully expensive.
At Party City, new costumes for kids start at $20 and go up to $65 for an elaborate "good witch" costume.
For adults, the prices are even scarier.
A simple adult Batgirl dress is $17, but if you want to be Elphaba — the green witch from the Broadway show “Wicked” — prepare to spend at least $180 for the outfit (not including an additional $20 for the witch wig).
But there are some cheaper alternatives for those willing to make their own costume.
Here are a few ideas
Ghost
All that’s needed for this staple costume is an old sheet.
Just punch a couple of holes for your eyes and you’re ready to go.
But, if you want to stand out, wear neon shoes — the only part of you that’ll actually be seen — and draw designs on the sheets to add some color.
Andrew Rich/Getty Images/Vetta Use make-up to draw freckles, pick up a pair of cheap reading glasses from your local pharmacy and embrace your geeky side. Dreamstime Buy foundation that is several shades lighter than your skin tone, even put on red lipstick to exagerate the contrast. Gardiner Anderson/for New York Daily News Costumed performer Roberto Torres is dressed as the Statue of Liberty in Battery Park in Manhattan, New York City on Tuesday, August 25 2015 Bryan Smith/for New York Daily News Waldo tours the 86th floor Observatory and 103rd floor parapet of the Empire State Building to celebrate the 25th anniversary everyone's favorite globetrotter - 'Where's Waldo?' in Manhattan on Friday September 21, 2012. Previous Next Enlarge
Nerd
Use make-up to draw freckles, pick up a pair of cheap reading glasses from your local pharmacy and embrace your geeky side.
Vampire
Buy foundation that is several shades lighter than your skin tone, even put on red lipstick to exagerate the contrast.
Next, find a cape — which can be found for as low as $12 — and some fangs. Before you know it, you’ll be a walking “Twilight” reference.
